comment: Online class was pretty simple. Not a lot of homework: a open book quiz and discussion question due every week. Two assignments (a paper and a presentation)due throughout the year and a midterm and final exam. The discussions aren't difficult but do require just a little more effort than copying what is in the text book. Very fair grader.

Prof. Meneses was a good Professor! Course had 4 Discussions, 8 quizzes, and 7 written assignments. The written assignment weren't really essays though. Maybe one to two pages of work and citations really wasn't hard at all. She recapped every chapter for us at the end. Didn't have to email her much because she made things really clear in D2L!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: Prof Meneses was honestly great for my online global issues course. Only one open note quiz and one discussion post a week, no responses are required and the criteria is very clear. 10/10 would take again!
A good bit of reading but most of the important stuff is mentioned during lecture/on her PowerPoints. Very kind and interesting professor, if you want to take love and sex take it with her.
the quizzes are easy enough. but the written assignments are fine, but she will grade them roughly.

the quizzes are FIVE questions and are on lockdown browser + webcam. If you miss one quiz question, you are already at a B. Very often, the questions do not make sense/ have improper grammar. I have emailed Dr.M NINE times and she replied ONLY THREE times. Difficult to reach. Reading the textbook does not help as questions are unrelated/ hard.

I took POLS 1101 online. Class work was easy, and Dr. Meneses is an easy grader when it comes to essays and discussions. However, myself and most of the class often got bamboozled by tests and quizzes no matter what lecture we watched, chapter we read, or notes we took
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: Definitely an awesome professor to take! She is very nice and funny. It is recommended to read the book, but it is not needed in order to get an A in the class. She does take attendance. There are 10 quizzes, a mid term, final, and group presentation. All are very easy to pass. I would definitely take this class again!!

Easily one of the most interesting classes I've ever taken. She is really funny and very real. I recommend reading to pass, but her lectures hold all the info. There's a quiz every week, but if you pay attention they're easy to do well on.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Loved taking her! Her classes are never boring, especially when she plays John Oliver when he discusses the issues we are covering in class. One pop quiz a week, and if you make all A's, you get an automatic A on your midterm/final. Theres also a group project that is presented each week and is a big part of your grade. Overall, great class!
